question_text: What is the function of the small switch found on some power supplies labeled 115V/230V?
answer_options: It selects between standby and full power modes
It adjusts the fan speed for cooling efficiency
It switches the AC input voltage based on region
It enables dual-rail output for GPUs
correct_answer: It switches the AC input voltage based on region
explanation: Some power supplies have a manual input voltage switch to toggle between 115V (U.S.) and 230V (Europe/Asia) AC input levels.
